Prominent rabbi has supported the killings of Palestinian civilians by Israeli occupation troops in the Gaza Strip, saying killing non-Jewish civilians is compatible with religious laws
 
 Rabbi Dov Lior "The law of our Torah is to have mercy on our soldiers and to save them. This is the real moral behind Israel's Torah and we must not feel guilty due to foreign morals," the Ma'ariv Israeli newspaper quoted him as saying
 
 "...a thousand non-Jewish lives are not worth a Jew's fingernail"
 Rabbi Dov Lior
 ------
 
 Well this seems like religious fundamentalism at his most pristine. Shining sparkling and unfortunately the voice of the right wing and many of the moderates. This creed of religious fundamentalism and the belief of being the "chosen ones" has gone to far. Israel must not feel obliged to foreign morals aka international law. They must disregard the people they were created by, the U.N. Israel must brush off the global community because killing is necessary (wouldn't that make suicide bombings necessary, because no life is above Palestinian life). Reparations for the Holocaust must be sought, but reparations for their genocide will never be given. I love the arrogance of Zionism, of religious fundamentalism, to believe that your god has instilled you the right to destruction, to hate, to the torture of innocent human beings. As an American I stand deathly afraid of Al Qaeda and Islamic fundamentalism, but sadly Zionism has killed many more. This idea that sending missiles into crowded rallies is any different than bombing pizza parlors is ridiculous. Oh wait there is a difference, one is ordered by extremists (Hamas) and one is ordered by Sharon and Mofaz under the State of Israel. Oh how I do love that democracy. 
 
 Remi

The IMF predicted that Israel's gross domestic product would contract by 1.5 percent this year. It also forecasts an inflation rate of 6.2 percent this year and 3 percent in 2003. Combined with the bleak global economic scene, these numbers should be ringing many bells within Israel.

 Agreed. Unfortunately, a majority support Sharon's policies for not just their basic Zionist philosophies, but because every government, the US included, waves the flag and going against the image of patriotism is difficult for a majority of people to comprehend. Sharon's current policy of razing refuge camps and personal property while killing civilians on what seems to be a random basis may put the situation in a position of being irretrievable for a peaceful settlement. A great number of Palestinians cross the 'border' into Israel everyday to work and people can only be pushed just so far. Too many generations have been raised on hate for it just go away. I feel Israel's current strategy is to fence in as much of what they now control as possible, eliminate resistance leadership, demoralize the remaining Palestinian population to a point of sub-severance and establish a fortress type mentality. As Israel is desperate for foreign investment, they feel, IMO, that type of stability will encourage world bankers to open their purse strings.  Come on man. You don't trust me. I must say I'm a little hurt. Haven't see you at the site in a while, but I'm sure you are busy. I must forewarn, you are not going to like my source, but nonetheless here goes. I could get you his ruling, but I didn't quote the ruling (which was made public), I quoted the site. Not everything on AlJazeera is violence driven propaganda, there are legitimate articles too.
 
 http://english.aljazeera.net/NR/exeres/94812266-7218-4544-9DB2-A8E4D61FFB0E.htm

AlJazeera is known for reporting the initial story and only reporting one side of it. What a source.
daewoo

Lets all remember that during the war in afghanistan, Bush himself got up and commended Al-Jazeera for their impartial reporting. I know that irks some of you folks who prefer to believe that if it sin;t on fox it didn't happen. One hting you can be certian of is that if it is the AJ web page, they have video or recordings to go with it. This is one thing I like about their channel. They are well aware of the fact that their crdibility is in question, so they make sure that in addition to the talking heads, they have video or pictures to back up every story and they don;t tend to sensationalise things.
 
 Since theri spin is not 100% pro American, you get more accurate stories in many cases. Do you rememebr when they pulled down the statue of saddam? THe American press showed all these tight angle shots and led you to believe that this was a huge group of people. AJ showed the wide angle shots of teh square, and you saw right away that it was 50 people, tops. 
 
 I don't want to see a new chanel being used as a propoganda outlet. When I turn on the news, I want to see news. The US news stations are no better, and maybe worse, about reporting only part of the story. I say watch them both, then form your own opinions.
